item.title: Government asks police to 'please explain' after convicted paedophile allowed to work at petting zoo
item.description: Steven James Harvey was exposed in a 9News investigation two months ago and locals are outraged to find he still has a job, as a fresh police probe gets underway.

item.title: Robert Irwin's hometown hosts lookalike contest to celebrate wildlife warrior's return home
item.description: "If Bindi Irwin had been here, she would have done a double take."

item.title: Federal government to separate elements of hate speech bill after Greens pull support
item.description: The bill due to be voted on in coming days has met with opposition from both the Coalition and the Greens.

item.title: No sign of new protests in Iran as a hard-line cleric calls for executions and threatens Trump
item.description: As Iran returned to uneasy calm after a wave of protests that drew a bloody crackdown, a senior hard-line cleric called on Friday for the death penalty for detained demonstrators

item.title: Two charged after police officer wedged between two vehicles following pursuit
item.description: When police arrived on the scene, a white van allegedly hit a male officer before fleeing the scene.

item.title: Six-hour delay for passengers after plane turns back to Adelaide twice
item.description: A QantasLink flight bound for the South Australian city of Port Lincoln was forced to turn around twice this morning, resulting in a six-hour delay for passengers.

item.title: Massive clean-up after flash flooding hits Victoria's Great Ocean Road
item.description: The Great Ocean Road has re-opened to traffic around the communities smashed by extreme flash flooding as residents and holidaymakers begin the huge clean up.

item.title: Family of Iranian protester searched for her body in a pile of corpses and buried her on a roadside
item.description: Aminian's mother had to look through piles of bloodied corpses to find her daughter's body. Then the family raced to escape authorities who might demand payment to release the body and buried her hastily in an unmarked roadside pit.

item.title: Evacuations in Sydney's Northern Beaches, millions across NSW told to stay indoors
item.description: Warnings come hours after the intense weather turned deadly.

item.title: Today in History - January 18: Police had a suspected serial killer's confession, but it wasn't enough proof
item.description: Boston man Albert DeSalvo was jailed for life on January 18, 1967, after being found guilty of assault and armed robbery against four women in Connecticut.

item.description: T﻿he tariffs would begin next month

item.title: Brewery co-owner Jaz had a bold idea for a non-alcoholic beer. It has paid off big time
item.description: Jaz Wearin and her husband Grant began Modus Operandi in 2014 on Sydney's northern beaches with just $7 and a dream.

item.title: National day of remembrance to remember Bondi terror victims this week
item.description: To be held on Thursday, the event will have the theme "Light will Win, a Gathering of Unity and Remembrance".

item.title: Hundreds of jellyfish sweep into Melbourne swimming spot
item.description: A refreshing dip became rather hazardous for swimmers today when a large bloom of Lion's Mane jellyfish washed into Port Phillip Bay in Victoria.

item.title: Plans to make it illegal to leave dogs in hot cars in NSW
item.description: The NSW government is proposing law changes to criminalise leaving dogs in hot cars.

item.title: Dashcam captures lightning strike metres away from driver on NSW Mid North Coast
item.description: A man was sitting in his car when his dashcam captured the dramatic moment lightning struck the footpath.

item.title: Thousands of health workers to strike in Victoria
item.description: More than 10,000 healthcare workers will go on strike in Victoria, forcing hospital bed closures and surgery cancellations.

item.title: Indonesian rescuers find a body and wreckage of plane in mountainous region
item.description: Indonesian rescuers have recovered a body in the ongoing search for 11 people aboard a plane that is believed to have crashed the previous day while approaching a mountainous region on Sulawesi island during cloudy weather.

item.title: Today in History - January 19: Notorious drug lord flees prison in laundry cart
item.description: J﻿oaquin "El Chapo" Guzman would remain on the run for more than a decade after his infamous escape.

item.description: "China and Russia must be having a field day" after the US president's threat of new tariffs on eight countries.

item.title: Politics News - 9News - Latest political news today Australia and World
item.description: Latest political news from Australia and around the world, covering elections, by-elections, our regular leadership spills, poll results, Question Time debates and daily Australian party politics

item.description: Latest world news headlines: International breaking news and current affairs from US, Europe, Middle East, Asia, Africa and more. If it happens around the world, you will know about it on 9News

item.title: Crowds turned away as Sydney's $830 million fish market finally opens
item.description: People have reportedly been told they must wait in line to get into the building - even if they have a booking at one of the restaurants - or come back later when the crowds have died down.

item.title: Man hospitalised after being attacked by fox north of Melbourne
item.description: Paramedics treated a man in his 50s for lower-body injuries after he was bitten by a fox.

item.title: Australian billionaires' wealth rose by $600,000 per day in 2025: new report
item.description: A new report has found the average Australian billionaire saw their wealth rise by almost $600,000 per day in 2025, while one in three households faced food insecurity.

item.title: Suspected bull shark takes 15cm chunk out of boy's surfboard day after teen mauled
item.description: The 11-year-old has narrowly avoided injury after the shark took a chunk out of his surfboard.
